a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Contribution to global mean surface temperature rise, 1851 to 2023
The global mean surface temperature change as a result of a country or region's cumulative emissions of three
gases – carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide.
Note: This does not include cooling impacts from sulphur dioxide and aerosols, so the net warming can be lower.
